Cambodia: King Suriyopear (nephew of Sattha) installed with help of Ayutthaya.
Chile: General uprising of the Mapuches under Pelantaro. All cities south of the Bío-Bío River are demolished, in what is now called Destruction of the Seven Cities.
China: The Dutch East India Company (VOC) began shipping Chinese ceramics to Europe.
Indinesia: The Portuguese send a major (and last) expeditionary force from Malacca which succeeded in reimposing a degree of Portuguese control.
The Dutch East India Company (VOC) is established by merging competing Dutch trading companies.

British East India Company's first voyage, commanded by Sir James Lancaster, arrives in Aceh and sails on to Bantam where he is allowed to build trading post which becomes the centre of British trade in Indonesia until 1682.
Philippine: Pedro Bravo de Acuña appointed Governor-General (1602–1606).
